akk: (_mul2_-ar2)-sza2-_sag_-_hun 1 1_/2 _kusz3_ sin 4 _kusz3_ ana _ulu3 sig_ e _an 2 kusz3_ sin 4 _si_ ana _nim dib ge6 23_ ina _zalag2_ sin ina _igi mul2-mul2 2 kusz3 23 si gin ge6 24_ ina _zalag2_ sin ina _igi_ is-le10 2 _kusz3_
en: Arietis, the moon being 4 cubits low to the south, 2 cubits above Mars, the moon having passed 4 fingers to the east. Night of the 23rd, last part of the night, the moon was 2 cubits in front of eta Tauri. The 23rd, the north wind blew. Night of the 24th, last part of the night, the moon was 2 cubits in front of alpha Tauri,

akk: (_mul2_-ar2)-sza2-_suhur_-_masz2 8 si_ sin 1/2 _kusz3_ ana _nim dib 9 si gin# 12 8-20 szu2 nu pap ge6 13 6 me_ musz 13 5 na musz _ge6 14 2 ge6_ musz _usan_ sin _sig mul2_-_kur_-sza2-_dur#_-[nu-nu]
en: Capricorni, the moon having passed 1/2 cubit to the east. The 9th, the north wind blew. The 12th, moonset to sunrise: 8° 20'; I did not watch. Night of the 13th, moonrise to sunset: 6°, measured. The 13th, sunrise to moonset: 5°, measured. Night of the 14th, sunset to moonrise: 2°, measured; first part of the night, the moon was 1 cubit 6 fingers below eta Piscium,

akk: (_mul2_-e)-sza2-_sag_-_gir2-tab 20 si 6 zi ir kur gin ge6 7 sag ge6_ sin ina _igi mul2#_-_kur_-sza2-_kir4_-szil-_pa 3 kusz3_
en: Scorpii. The 6th, ZI IR, the east wind blew. Night of the 7th, beginning of the night, the moon was 3 cubits in front of theta Ophiuchi,

akk: (_mul2_-x)-sza2#-sze-pit2-_masz-masz 2 kusz3_ sin 2 _kusz3_ ana _si nim 19 si gin# ge6 20_ ina _zalag2_ sin ar2 _masz-masz_-sza2-_sipa 1 1_/2 _kusz3_ sin 4 1/2 _kusz3_ ana _si nim 20 si gin ge6 21_ ina# _zalag2_ sin _sig masz#_-[_masz_-ar2 n n]
en: Geminorum, the moon being 2 cubits high to the north. The 19th, the north wind blew. Night of the 20th, last part of the night, the moon was 1 1/2 cubits behind gamma Geminorum, the moon being 4 1/2 cubits high to the north. The 20th, the north wind blew. Night of the 21st, last part of the night, the moon was ... below beta Geminorum,

akk: (_mul2_-x)-sza2(?)-_sag_(?)#-[_gir2-tab_(?) _n n_ sin _n n_ ana] _ulu3# sig 3 si gin ge6 4 sag ge6#_ sin ina _igi mul2_-_kur_-sza2-_kir4_-szil-_pa 1 kusz3_ sin 2 _kusz3_ ana _ulu3 sig ge6 5 usan an sig rin2_-sza2#-[_si 3_] _kusz3 5 si gin_ [_ge6 6_]
en: beta/delta Scorpii, the moon being ... low to the south. The 3rd, the north wind blew. Night of the 4th, beginning of the night, the moon was 1 cubit in front of theta Ophiuchi, the moon being 2 cubits low to the south. Night of the 5th, first part of the night, Mars was 3 cubits below beta Librae. The 5th, the north wind blew. Night of the 6th,

akk: (_mul2_-x)-sza2-sze-pit2-_masz-masz 2 kusz3_ sin i-s,a ana [x x ... _ge6 25_ ina _zalag2_]
en: 2 cubits below eta /mu Geminorum, the moon being a little ... Night of the 25th, last part of the night,

akk: (_mul_x2)(()(_ab2_)())_hun-ga2_ ar2 _an 10 si gub_ sin _tur3 nigin2 si4_ ina _sza3 gub 20 an_ ina 2-30
en: stood in the region of Aries, 10 fingers behind Mars; the moon was surrounded by a halo, and alpha Scorpii stood in it. The 20th, Mars was 1 finger to the left
first appearance in the Old Man. The river level ...
Ur, 5th day of Shabatu, 10th year of Shamash-shum-ukin, king of Babylon.

akk: (a-na)szesz#-gu10 i-lu# me-me-me (u2-na-am-ba)i#-lu me-me-me i-lu du3-bi me-me-me
en: I lament for my brother, I lament, I lament in every way.

akk: (all broken on obv-, and ca- 2/3 of rev-, after which:) 20 _si_ x x x# [...]
en: ... 20 fingers ...

To the god Amurru, his lord: Shalmaneser, appointee of the god Enlil, vice-regent of Ashur, son of Ashurnasirpal II, vice-regent of Ashur, son of Tukulti-Ninurta II, who was also vice-regent of Ashur:
He Shalmaneser spoke ... to Ashur-bel-ka''in, the field marshal:
They shall carry out the necessary repairs to the wall footing and they shall renew the roof.

The lord of kings, my lord, gave the following order to all the magnates: "Whoever has a scholar in his presence but hides him from the king and does not send him to the palace, the king's ... will ... him."

akk: (d#)na3#-ku-du-ur2-[ri-uri3] _lugal_ babila2#[(ki)] za-ni-in e2-sag-il2# u3 e2-zi-da# _ibila_ a-sza-re-du sza (d)na3-ibila-uri3 _lugal_ babila2(ki)
en: Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, who provides for the E-sagil and the E-zida, foremost son of Nabopolassar, king of Babylonia.

akk: (d#)na3#-ku-du-ur2-ri#-uri3# _lugal_ babila2(ki#) za-ni-in e2-sag-il2# u3 e2-zi-da# _ibila_ a-sza-re-du# sza (d)na3-ibila-uri3# _lugal#_ babila2#(ki#)
en: Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, who provides for the E-sagil and the E-zida, foremost son of Nabopolassar, king of Babylonia.

akk: (d#)nergal# ina di#-'i# x [...] la i-gam-mi-il# nap-[...]
en: Nergal from headache may he not spare, his life ... .

akk: (d(!))#ku(!)-([[nu]])-usz(!)—kad(!)-ru(!)# _nu_-_mesz dingir_-_mesz uru_-[_mesz id_-_mesz_] _gisz-ig_-_mesz kug-gi_ [an-ze-e] _ur-mah_-_mesz ka_ né-rab# [x x]
en: Kunush-kadru, the images of gods, cities and rivers, the Golden Doors, the Thunderbirds, the Lions of the Gate of Entry ...,
... wine

akk: (d(*))#nam-ru sza# i-na _zag_ sza _dingir_ az#-[za]-qa-ap# i-na _ugu# ki_-[_tusz_] ku-u-nu x#+[x x] _sza#_-[bu] sza _lugal#_ [_en_-ia]
en: I have set up the panther which is on the right side of the god; it stands firmly on the pedestal. The king, my lord, can be glad.
Ashur shall be his prosecutor.

akk: (d(?))a(?)#-x (x) x _gal_(?)#-u _lugal kisz_ (d)[_nun-gal_(?) u(?)] x x x x x x _en kur_(?)-_kur_(?)# [...] _an_(?)# x x (x) x _bu_ x [...] _an_(?)-_szar_(?)# x x x E x [...] (d)_amar-utu en til_ e-pir(?)# kisz-szat# [_un-mesz_(?)] szA(?)#-ri-ku _da_(?) x [x] (d)30 e(?)#-tel(?) _an_-e U(?)# [_ki_-tim] szA(?)-qu#-u (d)_szesz_(?)#-[_ki_(?) _dingir-mesz_(?)] (d)#_utu_ x x nam(?)-ru# _kul_/_mu_(?) _sza_ [...] [x] x _sza#_ [(x)] _bi_(?)# za-ma-[ni ...] [x (x)] x x (x) x _ma szeg_(?) [...] [...] _sza# asz_ x [...] [...] _nu_(?)# _ma_ (x) [...] [...] x _asz_ [...]
en: The god Ashur, great lord, king of all the Igigu gods and Anunnaku gods, lord of the lands ... ..., Ashur ... ...; i 5 the god Marduk, lord of all, who provides all people with food and grants ...; the god Sîn, lord of heaven and netherworld, exalted one, divine light of the gods; the god Shamash, bright ... ... i 10 ... the foe ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ...
Kindazi
GILIMA, establisher of the binding of the gods, creator of stability,
O Nabu, sage of the gods . . .
May my personal goddess stand at my left.
Ishtar, Ishtar-of-the-Staff, Ber, Tammuz
The god Sîn, king of the gods, lord of the gods, ... ... ... ... ... the deities Sîn, Nusku, ... ..., Ishtar, and ...
Sennacherib, king of Assyria.
Ditto by Nabû, Nusku, Urash and Nergal!

akk: (d)#[...] ina _kur-kur_ at-tal#-[la-ku Asz-ku-nu da-na-nu u li-i-tu] Asz-t,ur-ma# [a-na ah-rat u4-me e-zib]
en: I wrote out an inscribed object bearing my name and the praise of my heroism — with which through the support of the deities Ashur, Sîn, Shamash, Bel Marduk and Nabû, Ishtar of Nineveh, Ishtar of Arbela, Ninurta, Nusku, and Nergal, I constantly marched through the lands and established mighty victories — and I deposited it for future days.
... the god ...
Nabû, my lord, put an earring on me, let me make you happy in the Edubba!
May Nabû and Marduk bless the king, my lord!

akk: (d)#[_ag_]-ku#-dur-ri-u#-[s,u-ur] _lugal#_ ba-ab-[il-_ki_] musz#-[te-e']-e-_u#_ asz-ra#-[a-ti (d)_ag_] U (d)_amar-utu en#_-[_mesz_-szu a-na-ku]
en: I am Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, who constantly strives for the sanctuaries of his lords Nabû and Marduk.
. . . Ashur . . .
O Adad . . .
Namtar ...

akk: (d)#[_nam_]-_erim sag-du udu-uz szu-2 gir-2 lu_-_mesz_ (d)_ne-du8 i-du8 ki-tim sag-du ur-mah szu-2 lu_-_mesz gir-2 muszen_ mim-ma lem-nu 02 _sag-du_-_mesz_-szu 01 _sag-du ur-mah 02_-u _sag-du_ x [x x x x]
en: The Oath had a goat's head, his hands and feet were human. Nedu, the porter of the underworld, had a lion's head, and human hands, his feet were those of a bird. Total Evil had two heads, one was the head of a lion, the second was the head of ....
Papsukkal
Umushana
Ashur-narari, vice-regent of the god Ashur, son of Ishme-Dagan II who was also vice-regent of the god Ashur:

akk: (d)#[szar-rat-kid-mu-ri szA ina] ug-gat# [lib-bi-szA] at-man-[szA e]-zi#-[bu] u-szi-bu [a-szar la si-ma-a-ti-szA] ina _bala_-ia dam#-[qi szA _an-szar_ isz-ru-ka] tar#-szA-a [sa-li-mu]
en: The goddess Sharrat-Kidmuri, who in her anger had abandoned her inner sanctum and i 35' had taken up residence in a place not befitting her, relented during the favorable reign lit. "my favorable reign" that the god Ashur had granted me.

akk: (d)#[x x x x x] (d)[x x x x x] (d)x [x x x x] a-szib# [x x x x] _kur_-e-bi#-[ih x x x] (d)[x x x x x]
en: the god ......, the god ......, the god ...... who dwells ..., Mt. Ebeh, ..., ......,

akk: (d)#É-_a man zu-ab en idim a_-_mesz#_ la ba-la-t,i lisz-(te)-szir4-ku-nu a#-ga-nu-til-la-a li#-mal-li-ku-nu
en: May Ea, king of the Abyss, lord of the springs, ... you deadly water, and fill you with dropsy.

akk: (d)#é-a i-szem-me# szA szu-mi# szat,-ru# i-pa#-[Asz]-szi-t,u s,a-lam _lugal#_-u-ti-ia# [i-ab-ba]-tu# lu#-u a#-szar-szu [u]-na-kar#-[(u)]-ma# [it]-ti# s,a-[lam-szu] la i-szak-[kan] (d)é-a _en_ s,i-i-ru ag-gi-isz lik-kil-me-szu-ma _gisz-gu-za lugal_-ti-szu li-szA-bal-kit-ma li-t,i-ir be-lut-su _mu_-szu _numun_-szu ina _kur-kur_ li-hal-liq-ma a-a ir-szi-szu re-e-mu
en: But as for the one who erases my inscribed name, or destroys my royal statue, or changes its position and does not place it with his own image, may the god Ea, 90 exalted lord, glare at him angrily, overthrow his royal rule, and take away his sovereignty. May he Ea make his name and his descendants disappear from the lands and have no pity on him!

akk: (d)#_ag_-A-u#-s,ur _lugal ka-dingir-ra-ki_ ti#-ri-is, _szu-ii_ (d)_amar-utu en_-szu sza il-bi-in _sig4#-al-ur#-ra ku_-tim e#-pi-isz _kar id_-a-ra#-- ah-tim a-na# (d)_amar-utu_ be-li#-szu
en: Nabopolassar, king of Babylon, the protégé of the god Marduk who makes baked bricks, the one who built the embankment of the Arahtu River for the god Marduk, his lord.

akk: (d)#_ag_-_nig-du_-u-s,u-ur _lugal# ka-dingir-dingir#_-[_ki_] _re_-É-_um_ ki-i-nim mu-usz-te-'-u# ma-ha#-zi sza gi-mi-[ir] É#-_kur-ra_ a-na-[ku]
en: I am Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, true shepherd, who strives constantly for the sanctuaries of all the temples.

akk: (d)#_amar-utu en gal_-u re-s,u-ti il-lik# [...] u-bal#-lit, _zi_-ti# _erim-hi-a_-ia 20 u4-me 7 [...] sza mi-s,ir _kur_-mu-s,ur Asz-ta-kan# nu-bat-ti# [...] ul#-tu _uru_-ma-ag#-[da]-li a-di _uru_-me#-[em-pi ...] mi-szi-ih-ti 40 _kaskal-gid_ qaq-qar# ar-de# [...] qaq-qa-ru szu-a-tu ki-ma _na4-zu#_-[_masz-da_ ...] ki-ma s,ip-ri _gisz_-szil-ta-hi# [...] da-mu u szar-ku el#-[...] _lu-kur_ ak-s,i a-di# [...] a-na# _uru_-is-hup-[ri ...] [...] x (x) _an_ [...]
en: The god Marduk, the great lord, came to my aid ... rev. 10 he revived my troops. Twenty days and seven ... of the border of Egypt, I stayed overnight. ... from the city Migdol to Memphis ... I advanced a distance of forty leagues ... that terrain is like gazelle-tooth stone ... rev. 15 like the head of an arrow ... blood and gore ... ... a dangerous enemy, together with ... to the city Ishupri ... ... ...

akk: (d)#_amar-utu u_ [(d)zar-pa-ni-tu x x] te(?)#-bi [x x x x x x] [x x x]+x#+[x x x x x x x]
en: May Marduk and Zarpanitu ......

akk: (d)#_amar-utu#_ u(?) (d)zar(?)-pa(?)#-[ni-tum(?)] _en-mesz_-e-a u-sze-pa 2 _nig-na ku-gi# husz-a_ szA _min6 gun 2 ma-na_ ki#-ma si-ma-ti-szu-nu resz-ta-a-ti u-sze-pi-isz s,a#-lam(?) szA-ru#-ti-ia# mu#-ut-nen-nu-u x x x x x
en: I made the ... of the god Marduk and the goddess Zarpanitu, my lords, glorious. I had two censers of reddish gold, whose weight is two talents and two minas, remade according to their original appearances. A statue of my royal majesty, shown as a pious person, ...
O Marduk, may you indeed be the one who does him harm!
O Marduk, my lord, grant me a long life!

You, lord of kings, are Marduk1 whose fury is the Deluge and whose glance is a merciful father. Let them give me my property, as the chief judge decided, and the property of my paternal estate, so that I may serve the king there.

akk: (d)#_amar-utu_ x#+[x x x x x x x x x x x x x]
en: Marduk ......
Asalluhi, their creator ... ... ... ....

akk: (d)#_asz-im5-babbar zalag an#-ta-mesz_ [mu]-szah#-li ek#-[le-ti ...] x sza ina _igi-du8#-a_-szu te#-[disz-ta] szak#-nu u-szA-pu#-[u s,a-ad-da pi-i _un-mesz_ u-kan-nu ...] [kab(?)]-tu szA (d)a#-nim (d)_en#_-[_lil_ u (d)]é#-a par-s,u-szu# [...] [_dingir_(?)] réme-nu-u szA it-ti# [(d)_utu_ bu]-uk-ri-szu szi-tul#-[tu i-szak-ka-nu ...] [x] x ba-nu-u na(?)#-[ram(?)] _dingir_ u (d)15 ha-mi-[im pa-ra-as, (d)a-nU-u-ti ...] [na]-din# _gisz-gidru gisz-gu-za bala#_-[e] _u#_ a-ge-e _en_-u-ti# [...] ha(?)-a'-it,(?)# lib-bi _un#_-[_mesz_ mu-na-hisz] ka-la da-Ad-me# [a-szib é-hul-hul szA qé-reb _uru-kaskal en gal_-e _en_-szu]
en: the god Namrashit Sîn, the light of the upper world, who illuminates the darkness, ... at whose appearance renewal is present, makes signs appear, and establishes the mood of the people, the honored one, whose divine powers are the gods Anu, Enlil, and Ea, ..., the merciful god, who takes counsel together with the god Shamash, his child, ... ..., the creator, beloved of god and goddess, who gathers to himself all divine offices of the highest rank, ..., who bestows the scepter, throne, palû-insignia, and crown of rulership, ..., who sees into the hearts of the people, who makes all settlements prosper, who resides in Ehulhul that is inside the city Harran, the great lord, his lord —

akk: (d)#_en-lil u_ (d)_nin#_-[_lil_ x x x] a-na le-mu#-[ut-ti x x x]
en: May Illil and Mulliltu ... consign him to misfortune.
Ellil
Expert Enlilbanda, greeted with reverence,

akk: (d)#_er3-ra_ ha-me-ru la-le-e-a ul asz2-ba-a la-la-szu2 it#-ta-tal-kan(!)(I-)ni (d)#_er3-ra_ ha-me-ru# la-le(!)(e-)e(!)(_li_-)a ul asz2-ba-a la-la-szu2 it#-ta-tal-kan(!)(I-)ni
en: "Erra, my husband, full of sexual charms, I am not sated with his sexual charms, yet he goes off me. Erra, my husband, full of sexual charms, I am not sated with his sexual charms, yet he goes off me."
Ereshkigal opened her lit. his mouth to speak; she said these words to Kakka:

akk: (d)#_gisz-bar_ na-din ma-ka-li a#-na _dingir_-_mesz gal_-_mesz mu#_-_mesz_-ku-nu _numun_-_mesz_-ku#-nu ina (d)_gisz-bar_ liq-mu
en: May Girra, who gives food to the great gods, burn up your name and your seed.
Gilgamesh was cutting down trees, Enkidu was constantly looking for the best timber.
Enlil, the most high lord, mountain of the Igigi,
May Palil, the foremost lord, let eagles and vultures eat your flesh.

akk: (d)#_im gu-gal an_-e _ki-tim a#_-[_kal_(?)] ina _kur_-ku#-[nu] lip-ru-[us] ta-me-ra-a-ti-ku-nu li-za-am#-[mi] ina ri-ih-s,i dan-ni _kur_-ku-[nu x x x] _buru5_ mu-s,a-hi-ir _kur buru14_-ku-nu le#-[kul] ik-kil _na4-ur5_ u _nindu_ ina É-_mesz_-ku-nu a-a _gal_-szi _sze-pad_-_mesz_ a-na t,i-ia-ni lu tah-li-qa-ku-nu ku-um _sze-pad_-_mesz_ es,-ma-ti-ku-nu _dumu_-_mesz_-ku-nu _dumu-mi_-_mesz_-ku-nu li-t,i-nu ki-s,ir szA _szu-si_-ku-nu ina le-e-sze lu la i-t,a-ab-bu [x x x] a-s,u-da-ti-ku-nu le-e-szu le-kul _ama ugu dumu-mi_-szA [_ka_-szA le-di-il] ina bu-ri-ku-nu _uzu_-_mesz dumu_-_mesz_-ku-nu ak-la ina bu-bu#-[ti] hu-szah-hu _lu uzu lu_ le-kul _lu kusz lu_ li-la-bisz _uzu_-_mesz_-ku-nu _ur-ku_-_mesz szah_-(_mesz_) le-e-ku-lu e-t,im-ma-ku-nu pa-qi-du na-aq A-_mesz_ a-a ir-szi
en: May Adad, the canal inspector of heaven and earth, cut off seasonal flooding from your land and deprive your fields of grain, may he submerge your land with a great flood; may the locust who diminishes the land devour your harvest; may the sound of mill or oven be lacking from your houses, may the grain for grinding disappear from you; instead of grain may your sons and your daughters grind your bones; may not even your first finger-joint dip in the dough, may the ... of your bowls eat up the dough. May a mother bar the door to her daughter. In your hunger eat the flesh of your sons! In want and famine may one man eat the flesh of another; may one man clothe himself in another's skin; may dogs and swine eat your flesh; may your ghost have nobody to take care of the pouring of libations to him.

akk: (d)#_iszkur_ [_szeg-mesz_-szu u-masz-sze-ra] (d)#é-[a u-pat,-t,i-ra _idim-mesz_-szu] [5] _kusz sze#_-[_am_ isz-qu ina _ab-sin_-ni-szA] [e-ri-ik szu-bul-tu 5/6 _kusz_] [_si-sa buru14_ na-pa-Asz (d)nisaba] ka#-[a-a-an u-szah-na-bu gi-pa-ru] s,ip-pa#-[a-ti szu-um-mu-ha in-bu] _masz-ansze_ szu#-[te-szur ina ta-lit-ti] ina _bala-mesz#_-[ia HÉ-_nun_ t,uh]-du ina _mu-an-na#-mesz_-ia# [ku-um-mu-ru] HÉ#-_gal_-lum
en: The god Adad released his rains and the god Ea opened up his springs. Grain was five cubits high in its furrow and ears of corn were five-sixths of a cubits long. i 25' Successful harvests and an abundance of grain enabled pasture land to continually flourish, fruit orchards to be very lush with fruit, and cattle to successfully give birth to their young. During my reign, there was plenitude and abundance; during my years, bountiful produce was accumulated.

akk: (d)#_iszkur_ szA-ri-ik HÉ-_gal_ a-na _kur ka-gal#_ (d)_iszkur_ sza am-ba-si [(d)]er-ra mu-szam-qit a-a-bi _ka-gal#_ (d)_u-gur_ sza _uru_-tar-bi-s,i [(d)_igi_]-_sig7#-sig7_ mu-szam-me-eh s,ip-pa-a-ti _ka-gal gisz-kiri6-mesz# szu-nigin 3 ka-gal-mesz_ sza mé-eh-ret _im_-il-ta-a-ni at#-ta-bi zi-kir-szi-in
en: "The God Adad Is the Provider of Prosperity to the Land": this is the Adad Gate, which leads to the game preserve. "The God Erra Is the One Who Cuts Down Enemies": this is the Nergal Gate, which leads to the city Tarbishu. vii 15' "The God Igisigsig Is the One Who Makes Orchards Flourish": this is the Gate of the Gardens. In total, three gates facing towards the north and I gave them these names.

akk: (d)#_lamma sig5_ ana x x [...] _bu_((bul-lu-t,u)) szul-lu-mu (d)_amar-utu_ it-ti-ka-ma
en: ... a good tutelary goddess upon ... ..., ditto it is with you, Marduk, to heal and keep safe;

akk: (d)#_masz szesz_ ta-li-me-ka s,a-bat a-bu-ti qi-bi ba-ni-ti#
en: Ninurta, your favorite brother, intercede for me and order good things.
" 'Let the god Nergal march before you, let the god Girra come behind

akk: (d)#_nergal_x2(_u-gur_) ina la3 _gal2_(i)# [...] ar-ki-szu2 it-bal x x [...]
en: Nergal without being present ... after him, he disappears ...
Ditto by Mullissu, Sherua and Belet-ili!
He should not confront Nisaba in the open country, or heaven will detain him.
Papsukkal stands next to the projection in the wall next to the cella gate. They raise Anu's gold carrying-pole.
May Shazu rejoice over you, . . .
Tutu i.e., Marduk does not change the command of Nabu, his son.
Umushkita
Shamash, great lord, give me a firm positive answer to what I am asking you!

akk: (d)#_utu en gal_-u szA a-szal-lu#-[ka an-na _gi-na_ a-pal-an-ni]
en: Shamash, great lord, give me a firm positive answer to what I am asking you!

akk: (d)#_utu en gal_-u szA a-szal-lu-ka an-na _gi-na_ a-pal-an-ni
en: Shamash, great lord, give me a firm positive answer to what I am asking you!
Shamash, you are first and foremost among the gods, have mercy on me.

akk: (d)#_utu_ hu-ha-ru# szA _ud-ka-bar_ ina _ugu_-hi-ku-nu _dumu#_-_mesz_-ku-nu li-is-hu-up ina gisz-par-ri la na-par-szu-di li-di-ku-nu a-a u-sze-s,i nap#-szat-ku-un
en: May Shamash clamp a bronze bird trap over you and your sons; may he cast you into a trap from which there is no escape, and never let you out alive.
May Shamash with an iron plough overturn your city, your country and your district.
Shamash, bringer of order to the dead and the ..., scrutiniser of ...!
Shamash
O Divine Lamp, when you enter into the sick man's house,
Aya
Anu
Aya
the god Anu.
Anu and Ellil are joyfully exulting over you,
Anu placed it in the assembly of the gods.
Anu and Enlil are rejoicing joyfully on account of you.
Anu and Enlil are rejoicing joyfully on account of you.
. . . Anum, Enlil, and Ea . . .
The Anunnakki-gods greet you in their shrines.
The Anunnakki-gods greet you in their shrines.
Lady of the gods, who loves to preserve life,
If Venus enters inside it: the king's son will enter his father's house.
Ea written differently
Ea, his father ... water of the source
Ea opened his mouth to speak; he said to Nergal:
Ea
Enki, king of the Abzu, its foundations ... from the remote Underworld.
Behind? the god Haldi, behind? the weapon of the god Haldi,
the goddess Innina —
Innina, firstborn of Sin, offspring of Ningal,
my pupil

en: As for the goddess Nanaya, who 1,635 years ago became angry and went to live in the land Elam, iv 15 a place not befitting her, then, at that time when she — and the gods, her fathers — nominated me for ruling over the lands, iv 20 she entrusted me with the return of her lordly majesty, saying: "Ashurbanipal will bring me out of the land Elam and make me enter Eanna again."
the divine herald of Kulaba.
The Image, Ishhara, Gashranu, Eshertu, Bel-labria, Laban, Nabû, Gubaba, Abkuwa, the Roving Ishum, Maliku, Anunitu, Ulaya, Isinitu;

The king performs the installation of the enu-priest. He puts on his pure garments.
O Tashmetu, goddess of sexual charm and delight, lady of . . .
AGILIMA, the elevated one, remover of the tiara, inspector of snow,

Ningublaga
Nabu, who bears the tablet of destinies of the gods, inspector of Esagil,
Enlil, the counsellor, . . .
O Enlilkurra, warrior of . . . raging, fighter,
O Ishtar, . . .
May Enlil rejoice over you, may Ea be glad on your account.
scribe, son of Lipit-..., servant of Samsu-iluna.
The Seven Gods, Sons-of-Truth and Narudi; Ishtar and the Mountain; Ugurta and Ti'tu; Nergal of Kar-Nergal; Labranu:
Ditto by Ea and Damkina! Ditto by Sin and Nikkal!
May my personal goddess stand at my left.
. . . Ishtar, the lady of . . .

May my personal goddess stand at my left.
. . . my angry personal goddess . . .

akk: (d)15 _gaszan_ szur-bu-ti szi-pir szu-a-tu ha-disz lip-pa-lis-ma a-mat _munus-sig5_-ia lisz-szA-kin szap-tusz-szA muh-hi kul-lat na-ki-ri li-szam-ri-ir _gisz-tukul-mesz_-ia
en: May the goddess Ishtar, supreme lady, look upon this work with pleasure and may a good word for me be set upon her lips! May she make my weapons prevail over all my enemies!
Ishtar, wherever you curse, you quickly forgive,
May Ishtar, who dwells in Arbela, not show you mercy and compassion.

Ishtar dwells there, Nanaya, the ... daughter of Sin,
May Ishtar release, in Uruk the sheepfold;

en: he Nebuchadnezzar II brought the goddess Ishtar back safely, firmly reestablished her in her inner sanctum, reharnessed for her her seven lions, the insignia of her divinity, drove the unbefitting goddess out of Eanna, and returned the goddess Innina Ishtar to Eanna, her cella.

Ishtar-Kakkabi, wherever you curse, you quickly forgive,
The sun ......
O Sin, perpetually renewing one, who illuminates . . .
O Sin, perpetually renewing one who illumines . . .
May Sin make as bright as the light that illumines the boundary of the heavens.
O resplendent Sin of Ekur, they inquire of you, and you givee the oracle of the gods.
Sin, Shulpae, ... next to Adad. Lugalira, Il-Amurru, ... stand next to Ea.
the moon and the sun ......

Sin, Ningal, Marat-Sin, Shuziana, Ningal, Shamash, Kalkal.

The Moon god and his consort Nikkal ......
Sîn, Shamash, the image of Shamash, Nikkal, Aya, Bunene, Ebeh, Kittu, Umu, Tambaya:
Sîn, Shamash, the Image of Shamash, Nikkal, Aya, Bunene, Ebeh, Kittu, Umu, Tambaya:

akk: (d)30 (d)nin-gal (d)_utu_ (d)a-a u (d)nusku ha-disz lit#-[tap-la-su ...] ina ta-mar-ti _iti_ ur-ru u mu-szu e-ma (d)30 e-te-né-[ed-di-szu(?) ...] e-nu-ma it-ti (d)_utu_ ke-nisz in-nam-ma-ru x [...] kun-ni _suhusz gisz-gu-za lugal_-ti-ia szul-bur _bala_-[_mesz_-ia ...] _giszkim-mesz sig5_-tim sza _ud-mesz gid-da-mesz_ lisz-ru-ku#-[ni ...] _gisz-gidru_ i-szir-tu mu-rap-pi-szat _kur-kur u un-mesz_ [...] _mu-an-na#-mesz h_É-_nun_ u HÉ-_gal_-li li-szi-mu-ni-ma li-[...]
en: May Sîn, Ningal, Shamash, Aya, and Nusku continually look with pleasure upon me .... At the appearance of the new moon, during the day or at night, whenever Sîn always renews ... when he truly is sighted with Shamash ... to make the foundations of my royal throne firm and to make my reign endure .... May they grant me auspicious omens for a long life ... a just scepter, which expands the lands and people .... rev. 10 May they determine for me years of abundance and plenty, and .... May they be my support and may they kill my enemies and cut down my foes.
Ditto by Sin, Shamash, Adad and Marduk!
Sin interceded for the king with the gods; the king is safe.

akk: (d)30 / ina _iti-szu ud_-mu u-szal-[lam] _ud 14_-_kam ta_ (d)szA-masz in-na-mar#-[ma] _an-mi_ / u-sze-taq / la i-szA-[kan]
en: The moon will complete the day in Tammuz IV; on the 14th day, it will be seen with the sun. It will let the eclipse pass by; it will not make it.

en: The moon skipped the eclipse on the xth day. On the 15th day ... went

en: O Sîn, lord of the gods, king of the gods of heaven and earth, god of the gods and goddesses, the one who resides in the great heavens, when you joyfully enter this temple, may good things about Esagil,

akk: (d)30 _en gal_-u a-szib _uru-kaskal_ a-na (m)ma-ti-i'—_dingir dumu#_—[_mesz_-szu] _gal_-_mesz_-szu _un_-_mesz kur_-szu _sahar-szub-ba_-a _gim_ na-ha-lap-ti li#-[hal-lip] _edin_ li-ir-pu-du a-a _tuk_-szu-nu re-e-mu ka(*)-bu(*)-ut(*) _gud ansze udu_-_mesz ansze-kur-ra_-_mesz_ ina _kur_-szu a-a ib-szi
en: May Sin, the great lord who dwells in Harran, clothe Mati'-ilu, his sons, his magnates, and the people of his land in leprosy as in a cloak; may they have to roam the open country, and may there be no mercy for them. May there be no more dung of oxen, asses, sheep, and horses in his land.

akk: (d)30 _en gal_-u mu-nam-mir# uk-[li x x x x x x x x x x]
en: may Sin, the great lord, who lights up the darkness, ......

akk: (d)30 _en_ gim-ri ( o o o o ) kul2-lat-( o )si-na
en: Sin, lord of the whole universe,

akk: (d)30 _giskim sig5_-tim sza _gid-da ud_-me _bala_ a-na _lugal_ be-li-ia i-sa-ap-ra
en: The moon has sent a favorable omen on the length of the days of the reign to the king my lord.
Sin, keep safe his throne ......

akk: (d)30 _ta_(v) _an_-e u-sze-ra-da-a-ni _lugal_ be-li ina _ugu_ ina _sza_-bi e-gir-a-te-ia gab-bu sza ina _ugu lugal en_-ia Asz-pur-an-ni 01-te szi-i a-bu-tu ina _sza_-bi al-tu-u-da ina _ugu_ da-ba-bi sza x x#
en: O king, my lord, concerning this, in all the letters which I have sent to the king, my lord, there is just this one matter. I have been shamed. On account of the words that I have spoken ..., instead of Ashur-zeru-ibni ..., I have butted Marduk-ishmanni ....
Sîn, 27th day ...
The moon will be seen with the sun on the 14th day.

akk: (d)30 _ud 30_-_kam_ a-ta-mar szA-qi-a sza _ud 30_-_kam_ ina pi-it-ti i-szA-qi-a ki-i szA _ud 02_-_kam_ iz-za-az
en: I observed the crescent of the moon on the 30th day, but it was high, too high to be the crescent of the 30th. Its position was like that of the 2nd day. If it is acceptable to the king, my lord, let the king wait for the report of the Inner City before fixing the date.
The moon will complete the day, and the 30th day will be long.

akk: (d)30 an-ni-u (d)_nin-gal_ (d(*))#_pa_(*)-_tug_ sza _lugal_ be-li-((ia)) [e]-ni-szu-nu e-mur-u-ni _u#_ ip-la-hu-szu-nu#-[ni] [a-na] _lugal_ [_en_-ia x x x] [x x x x x x x x x]
en: May this Sin, as well as Nikkal and Nusku, to whom the king, my lord, has been obedient and whom he has revered, ...... to the king, my lord.
Sîn should not fall sleep to ... The ...-plant ...
The moon will ... for one year.

akk: (d)30 be-li _dingir-mesz lugal dingir-mesz_ szA _an_-e _u ki_-tim _dingir-mesz_ szA _dingir-mesz_ a-szi-ib _an_-e _gal-mesz_ a-na É szu-a-ti ha-di-isz i-na e-re-bi-ka _sig5-mesz_ é-sag-il2 é-zi-da é-gisz-nu11-gal É-_mesz dingir_-u-ti-ka _gal_-ti lisz-szA-ki-in szap-tuk-ka U pu-luh-ti _dingir_-u-ti-ka _gal_-ti lib-bi _un-mesz_-szu szu-usz-kin-ma la i-hat,-t,u-u a-na _dingir_-u-ti-ka _gal_-ti
en: O Sîn, lord of the gods, king of the gods of heaven and earth, god of the gods, the one who resides in the great heavens, when you joyfully enter this temple, may good things about Esagil, Ezida, and Ekishnugal, the temples of your great divinity, be set upon your lips. Moreover, have the fear of your great divinity placed in the hearts of his people so that they do not sin against your great divinity.

akk: (d)30 e-tel-li# _dingir_-_mesz_ szA-qu-u [x x x x x x x x x x x] _uru-sze a-sza gisz-sar_ szu-a-tu ha-disz x#+[x x x x x x x x x x x]

The moon will complete the day in month x.

akk: (d)30 ina É ((iti(?)))_ziz_ u (d)_utu_ ina É (iti)_sig4 dur_ szA a-ha-a-mesz [x x x] x x x [(x)]

At the appearance of the moon its right horn signifies the Westland.
The moon ... in front of ...
The moon will be seen with the sun in Tebet X on the 14th day.
The moon will complete the day in Nisan I.
The moon will complete the day in Shebat XI; on the 14th day it will be seen with the sun.
The moon will complete the day in Shebat XI.
The moon completed the day in this month.
Sin, subjugator of their sheepfolds.

akk: (d)30 na-nar _an_-[e u _ki-tim_ ina _sahar-szub_-pu] li-hal-lip-ku-nu [ina _igi dingir_-_mesz_ u _lugal_] e-re#-eb-ku-nu [a-a iq-bi ki-ma szér]-re#-me _masz-da edin#_ [ru-up]-da
en: May Sin, the brightness of heaven and earth, clothe you with leprosy and forbid your entering into the presence of the gods or king. Roam the desert like the wild-ass and the gazelle!

akk: (d)30 x#+[x x x x x x]
en: The moon .......
Sin
Sîn, Mandanu, Ninkarrak: the gods of GN.

akk: (d)30# [(d)nin-gal] u (d)nusku ep-sze-ti-ia dam-qa-a-ti# [ha-disz lit-tap]-la(?)#-su [...] x x-e i-da-at dum-qi li-szA-pa-a [...]-ia# [... bu-un-ni-szu(?)] nam#-ru-u-ti it-ti (d)_utu_-szi# [i-li-it(?)]-ti#-szu [...] szul#-bur isz-di _gisz-gu-za lugal_-ti-ia li-tap-pa-lu a-ha-mesz# [...]-ni _esz-bar_-szu szA szum-qut na-ki-ri-ia li-szak-li-im s,a-ad-du [... a-na ni-isz] _szu#-ii_-ia re-e-mu li-ir-szi-ma li-im-gu-ra qa-ba-a-a [...] _mu-an-na-mesz_ t,u-ub _uzu#-mesz_ hu-ud lib-bi li-szim szim-ti [(d)nin-gal ...] x a-na (d)30 na#-[ram]-i-szA li-ha-as-si-sa _sig5-mesz_-ia [...] _ad_(?)# u4-me-szam la na-par#-ka-a li-is,-bat ab-bu-ut-ti
en: May the deities Sîn, Ningal, and Nusku look with pleasure upon my good deeds. May the god Sîn make auspicious omens appear ... for my ... May he ... his radiant face with the god Shamash, his offspring, and may they discuss with each other ... the securing of the foundations of my royal throne. ... may he Sîn reveal his decision with a sign concerning the cutting down of my enemies. rev. 75 ... may he have mercy at my prayers and grant my pleas. May he determine as my fate ... and years of good health and happiness. May the goddess Ningal ... remind the god Sîn, her beloved, about my good deeds and ... daily, without ceasing, may she intercede on my behalf.

akk: (d)30# [_ud_-mu] u-szal-lam sza ba#-[a-di] re-esz _mu-an-na sig5_ sza# [_lugal_] _en_-ia

akk: (d)30# [x x x x x x x x x x]

en: Anu of ... PN ...

akk: (d)60 usz-ta-pa-a ina nap-har _kur-kur_ u3 it-ta-s,a-a s,a-lam ba-nu-u2 naq-bit i-qab-bu-u2
en: They speak the invocations 'Anu is made visible in all the lands' and 'He has come forth, the beautiful constellation'.
Ditto by the heroic Pleiades!
May Mar Biti, grand vizier of Nabû, make his name and his seed disappear from the land.
Palace of Neriglissar, king of Babylon.
The god ..., Tebetu Month X, the ... star, Belet-balati.
The god ..., Shabatu Month XI, the Great One.
O . . ., I turn to you by order of your great divinity.
O Sin . . . of you,
"Sîn in Ur, Shamash in Larsa" Maqlû II 193 ? ....

akk: (d)[30 mu-szu an]-ni-u _tur_ il-ti#-[bi-szu] _mul-gir_-[_tab_] gab#-bi-szu ina _sza_-szu it-ti#-[it-zi]
en: This night, a halo surrounded the moon, all of Scorpius stood inside it.

akk: (d)[30 u (d)]_utu dingir-mesz_ masz-szu-te Asz-[szu] de-en kit-te U mi-szA-ri a-na _kur_ u _un-mesz_ szA-ra-ku _iti_-szam-ma har-ra-an kit-te U mi-szA-ri s,ab-tu-ma
en: In order to give the land and the people verdicts of truth and justice, the gods Sîn and Shamash, the twin gods, took the road of truth and justice monthly.
Marduk

akk: (d)[_asz-im5-babbar_ e]-muq la sza2-na-an sza2 la i-lam#-[ma-du] mi-lik-szu2 ma-am#-[man]
en: O Namrashit, unrivalled in strength, whose advice no one can learn,
